definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: The flagship halal dish from China, hand-pulled noodles hail from the wild, sandy lands of northwest China.
sentences.chinese: 作为清真食品的代表，兰州拉面来自西北多沙的野外。

sentences.english: Ajisen Ramen "Kowloon City Plaza" branch launching.
sentences.chinese: 味千拉面九龙城广场分店现已开业。

sentences.english: I could make a fortress out of all the bricks of Ramen I have.
sentences.chinese: 我可以用我拥有的拉面作为砖来盖一座城堡。

sentences.english: "I want to know my parents' recipe for tonkotsu ramen, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “我想知道我父母做豚骨拉面的食谱，”他说。

sentences.english: It turns out that in recent period of time, become good noodle shop business.
sentences.chinese: 原来，近段时间，拉面店的生意开始变得不好了。

sentences.english: Doing this, the pull has doubled the length of the dough while fractioning its thickness. This process is repeated several times until the desired thickness and quantity is achieved.
sentences.chinese: 如此反复几次，直到长度与厚度达到拉面的要求。

sentences.english: Hand-pulled noodles are Chinese characteristic food.
sentences.chinese: 拉面是中国的特色小吃。

sentences.english: Word spread about his ramen, and the restaurant was always busy.
sentences.chinese: 关于他的拉面的消息传开了，餐馆总是很繁忙。

sentences.english: While the star Liu Daming degenerates into the restaurant waiter.
sentences.chinese: 而巨星刘达明则沦为拉面馆服务员。
味千拉面荷里活广场分店现已开业。

sentences.english: Soba and ramen noodles are the daily lunch of many people in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 凉面和拉面是许多日本人的日常午餐。

sentences.english: I want to teach you how to cook tonkotsu ramen. It's my best dish.
sentences.chinese: 我想教你做豚骨拉面，那是我最拿手的饭菜。

sentences.english: Ramen is about $0.33/pack, so I load up on it regularly.
sentences.chinese: 一包拉面大概是33美元，所以我经常吃。

sentences.english: Ajisen Ramen "Tsuen Wan Plaza " branch launching.
sentences.chinese: 味千拉面荃湾广场分店现已开业。
味千拉面德福广场分店现已开业。

definition: noodles served with soy sauce/sesame butter etc
oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
knife-shaved noodles (pared or shaved into strips), a Shanxi specialty
Sichuan noodles with a spicy and numbing sauce
zha jiang mian: ground pork simmered with salty fermented soybean paste (or other sauce) over thick wheat noodles
tempura/deep-fried cooking/also called 甜不辣[tian2 bu4 la4]
